availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fielding M. Bush Jr. (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. )

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Clark County, Kentucky native. Son of Fielding Bush and Adelaide Hallard Bush. Married to Sarah Elkin Bush in Clark County, Kentucky, on October 26, 1859. Father of Nora Bush and Adelaide Bush. Attended school in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Mercer County in 1860. Household owned an additional four enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 1, 1862, to January 1863. Reported as deserted from Warren County, Tennessee, in January 1863. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government in January 1863.

Texas Death Certificates, 1903-1982, Bureau of Vital Statistics, Department of State Health Services, Austin, TX.
